meanings.definition: A person who lives in seclusion, especially for religious reasons.
meanings.sent1: The eremites in the mountains spent their days in quiet prayer.
meanings.sent2: The small village had a few eremites who preferred solitude.
meanings.sent3: The eremites decided to have a picnic in the middle of the forest for some peace and quiet.
meanings.sent4: Hermit crabs are like eremites of the sea, carrying their homes on their backs.
meanings.sent5: The legend of the wise eremites who lived atop the hill was passed down through generations.

meanings.sent1: The eremites gathered in the monastery for their annual meeting.
meanings.sent2: Visitors were surprised to see a group of eremites living in the desert.
meanings.sent3: The eremites decided to throw a party to celebrate their seclusion.
meanings.sent4: The forest was filled with the whispers of the eremites, hidden from the world.
meanings.sent5: The painting depicted a gathering of eremites in deep meditation under the stars.
